statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Stephen Croone scored 17 points to help lead Furman to a 79-72 win over UNC-Greensboro on Monday night.
article.headline: Furman holds off UNC Greensboro, 79-72
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Stephen Croone scored 17 points to help lead Furman to a 79-72 win over UNC-Greensboro on Monday night. Kris Acox finished with 15 points and eight rebounds while Matt Rafferty also pulled in eight boards to go with his 11 points for Furman (15-11, 9-4 Southern Conference), which has won six of seven. The Paladins shot 52.9 percent from the field and had 15 total assists on their 27 made field goals. Kayel Locke scored 19 to lead UNC-Greensboro (9-16, 5-7). Diante Baldwin and Francis Alonso each had 12. Furman did not trail in the second half and opened up an eight-point lead (47-39) on a Rafferty 3-point play with 14:25 to go. The Spartans battled back to 64-61 on two Baldwin free throws, but Croone made a layup and Acox hit 3 of 4 at the line to extend the lead back to eight in the final minutes.
